creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: three men with large bundles on their backs hiking up the snowy face of a mountain; walking sticks in PR hands; a group of 4 men gathered near UR; mountain continues in background
inscription: left: 自摺　大正拾五年作　日本アルプス十二題の内　針木雪渓 {jizuri, Taishō jūgonen saku, Nihon Arupusu jūni dai no uchi, Harinoki Sekkei} | bottom, in pencil: Climbing Snow Valley | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Scenes in the Japan Alps (Nihon Arupusu jūnidai no uchi 日本アルプス十二題の内)
title: Climbing a Snow Valley at Harinoki
